comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:17.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/17.0
Build ID: 20130215125822

Steps to reproduce:

Using PDF.js 0.7.236 or 0.7.325 with Firefox 17.0.3 ESR on Linux

Clicking on the 'Download' button in the displayed PDF page does nothing


Actual results:

Error Console reports:

Error: [Exception... "'TypeError: setting a property that has only a getter' when calling method: [nsIRequestObserver::onStopRequest]"  nsresult: "0x8057001c (NS_ERROR_XPC_JS_THREW_JS_OBJECT)"  location: "<unknown>"  data: no]



Expected results:

Standard 'save' dialog should appear

It works OK with earlier PDF.js releases - e.g 0.7.45
comments.creator: james-p@moving-picture.com

comments.creator: mitzabmm@gmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:17.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/17.0

Reproduced this issue on Firefox 17.0.3 ESR (Build ID:20130215125822) and 17.0.4 ESR (Build ID:20130307074601) using Pdf.js add-on version 0.7.236. On Firefox 20 beta 7 (Build ID:20130325214615) and latest Nightly (Build ID:20130325105600) with pdf.js feature disabled, there is no issue when using the same add-on.
comments.raw_text:

comments.text:
I did more research about the bug and I noticed that the issue is reproduced on all Firefox 17 ESR builds and it reproduces between Firefox  Release 15 and Firefox Release 17.
This issue does not reproduce on Firefox Release 18,19,20. On Firefox Release 14, another error is reported on Error Console: "Timestamp: 03/29/2013 05:19:34 PM
Error: setting a property that has only a getter
Source File: jar:file:///home/calc/.mozilla/firefox/hkv84cy5.1/extensions/uriloader@pdf.js.xpi!/components/PdfStreamConverter.js
Line: 271"
comments.raw_text:

comments.raw_text: nsIChannel.contentDisposition was not writable before Firefox 18 (see bug 795442).
comments.text: nsIChannel.contentDisposition was not writable before Firefox 18 (see bug 795442).
comments.creator: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.author: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
moz.mihaelav@gmail.com
comments.creator: moz.mihaelav@gmail.com
comments.text:
It seems that only the ESR branch is affected and the problem is pdf.js related.
Where can we find the addon versions between 0.7.45 and 0.7.236 in order to find the regression range?
comments.raw_text:
It seems that only the ESR branch is affected and the problem is pdf.js related.
Where can we find the addon versions between 0.7.45 and 0.7.236 in order to find the regression range?

comments.creator: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.raw_text: AFAICT the only way is to use git bisect and build the add-on on your own.
comments.text: AFAICT the only way is to use git bisect and build the add-on on your own.
comments.author: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
mitzabmm@gmail.com
comments.text:
With PDF.js 0.7.236 Add-on, I have found this regression range:
Last good nightly: 2011-11-08 
First bad nightly: 2011-11-09

Pushlog:
http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?startdate=2011-11-08&enddate=2011-11-09
This is for the error from comment 2 which I consider related with the first error.
Please let me know if i could help more.

comments.raw_text: Could you verify whether http://107.22.172.223:8877/d9bc9dc148fe6ff/extensions/firefox/pdf.js.xpi fixes the problem?
comments.creator: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.author: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.text: Could you verify whether http://107.22.172.223:8877/d9bc9dc148fe6ff/extensions/firefox/pdf.js.xpi fixes the problem?

Thank you. We need to backport the fix if we really want to fix ESR 17 internal viewer. But is it worth it? The internal PDF viewer was disabled by default at that point. Also, users can install the latest add-on if they want to try PDF.js.
comments.author: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.creator: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp

comments.author: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.text:
Ah, ESR 17 internal viewer had no problem because it's based on a much earlier version than 0.7.45. Please disregard the previous comment.
We don't have to backport 795442 because the problem has been fixed in PDF.js side.
comments.creator: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
